body: Probably should at the very least revert the visual mode `crr` mapping. @mfussenegger pointed out that not being able to use the same mapping for normal and visual modes is not great, so perhaps we need a separate mapping for code actions.

Some options mentioned in chat:

- Don't map visual mode, but that means users have to map it themselves to a different key and they're left with the asymmetry
- `ga` (current function is redundant with `:ascii`)
- `gb`, `gz` or `g.`, but all lack mnemonic 
- `<alt-cr>` (used by some, it's the default keymap for quick-fix in intellij, which behaves similar)
- `<c-g>` (currently `:file`)

`<M-CR>` would be my preference (it's what I use today, no I am not biased). We have never added a default Alt binding before so this would be a new precedent, but I'm not aware of any compelling argument against it. Helix and Kakoune have both demonstrated that using Alt mappings works perfectly well.

The only risk I can think of is that the default value of `'ttimeoutlen'` might be too low on some very slow network connections. But I don't have any data to support that this is a real potential issue, it's just the only thing I can think of.
why not `ctrl-r` (mnemonic: "refactor")? The builtin `:help v_CTRL-R` is only for select-mode, not visual mode.
ctrl-r is for redo, unless you mean only for visual mode, which would be assymetric

IMAO `z` as a prefix, e.g. `z-` or `zd` would be great.

`z=` and `zw` are used for the builtin spelling check, in some aspects it can be said to be very similar to code action because code actions usually be used to fix diagnostic errors.

If we use `z-`, its function and key position could be similar to `z=`; and if we use `zd`, then we have the mnemonic d for diagnosis.

Most importantly, in this way, we can unify the key mapping in insert and visual modes.

Edit:
Just found out that `z-` and `zd` are both occupied, keep my recommendation for `z` as a prefix though. In addition, the default function of `z-` can be replaced by `zb` (which is used more), and there is no particular convenience for this function to be mapped to this position. I still recommend using `z-`, but this is a breaking change.

>> why not `ctrl-r` (mnemonic: "refactor")? The builtin `:help v_CTRL-R` is only for select-mode, not visual mode.
>
> ctrl-r is for redo, unless you mean only for visual mode, which would be assymetric

Almost all visual mappings are "asymmetric". `cr` is an excellent mnemonic because this mapping family is related to "change". Throwing out `cr` just because of visual mode is not a good tradeoff. https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/28537

issue.title: feat(defaults): visual CTRL-R for LSP mappings

labels.name: defaults
